questions.question: What is TypeScript?
options: A superset of JavaScript with static typing

questions.question: Who developed TypeScript?
What is the file extension for TypeScript files?
Which command is used to compile TypeScript to JavaScript?
What is static typing in TypeScript?
How do you declare a variable with a specific type in TypeScript?
What is an interface in TypeScript?
options: A way to define the structure of an object

questions.question: Which symbol is used for optional properties in interfaces?
What is a generic in TypeScript?
options: A way to create reusable components with different types

questions.question: How do you define a generic function?
What is the 'any' type in TypeScript?
options: A type that can represent any JavaScript value

questions.question: What is type assertion in TypeScript?
options: Telling the compiler to treat a value as a specific type

questions.question: Which keyword is used to define a class in TypeScript?
What is access modifier 'private' used for?
options: To restrict access to class members
To allow access from same package

questions.question: What is a union type in TypeScript?
options: A type that can be one of several types
A type that combines multiple types

questions.question: How do you define a union type?
What is the 'never' type in TypeScript?
options: A type for values that never occur

questions.question: What is a tuple in TypeScript?
options: An array with fixed number of elements of specific types

questions.question: Which file contains TypeScript configuration?
What is the purpose of the 'readonly' modifier?
options: To make properties immutable after initialization
